body.p: Born on December 13, 1817 in Sallisboro, Lewis County, Kentucky. Moved to Point Pleasant, Ohio in 1827 to be trained in the skills of bricklaying and plastering. Jolly and his family then settled in Campbell County in 1840. Married America Vickers on October 11, 1841. He was ordained as a Baptist preacher by his farther-in-law in 1842 and became a circuit preacher. In April of 1849, Jolly became the pastor of the Flagg Springs Baptist Church and moved his family into the community. Attributed credit for the construction of several buildings in Campbell County including, the Campbell County Courthouse, the California Christian Church, the Wesley Chapel Methodist Church, the St. Peter & Paul Church, the Flagg Springs Baptist Church, the Walnut Hills Academy, the Beech Grove Academy, and many homes. Died on September 25, 1900 in Mentor, Campbell County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Jack Wessling, "Jolly, James Monroe" in The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 495-496.
